column2: OKLAHOMA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Oklahoma

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If your vehicle is not equipped with ABS, pumping your brakes when you want to slow down:
column4: reduces tire consumption.
column8: stops you faster.

column2: 2. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 3. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 4. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column4: impair your judgment.
column8: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Pavement ends
column8: Double curve ahead

column2: 6. A defensive driver:
column4: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
column6: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column8: never drives below the speed limit.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Stop Sign Ahead
column8: Lane ends

column2: 8. When a vehicle is hydroplaning:
column4: the windshield wipers cannot keep the windshield clear of rain.
column6: the spray from large trucks reduces visibility.
column8: the tires lose contact with the road surface.

column2: 9. If your accelerator becomes stuck while driving, you should:
column4: shift to park and apply the brakes until you come to a complete stop.
column6: turn the engine off and try to drive the car safely off the roadway.
column8: shift to neutral, apply the brakes and try to drive the car safely off the road.
column10: hold the steering wheel firmly and turn the ignition off while the vehicle is moving.

column2: 10. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
column4: before consuming alcohol.
column8: before midnight.

column2: 11. The picture shows:
column4: a speeding fines doubled sign.
column8: a reversible road sign.

column2: 12. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 13. When parking downhill:
column4: turn your wheels towards the side of the road.
column8: turn your wheels away from the side of the road.

column2: 14. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 15. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: A steady red light.
column8: A police officer.

column2: 16. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 17. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column10: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 18. To drive defensively you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
column6: look only at the car in front of you while driving.
column8: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.

column2: 19. To avoid crashes with vehicles in your blind spots, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to see if your blind spot is clear, before changing lanes.
column6: adjust your rear-view mirrors every few minutes.
column8: sound your horn right before turning or changing lanes.

column2: 20. BAC is:
column4: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column8: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 21. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
column6: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
column8: try to turn right before the bus does.

column2: 22. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 23. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
column4: a deaf person.
column8: a blind person.

column2: 24. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column6: has no effect, they are different substances.
column8: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column10: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 25. To drive more safely at night:
column4: increase following distance.
column6: don’t drive when you are tired.
column8: make sure your headlights are working properly.
